contextId.information: The negative, "No" cancels out the idea of "ill" (bad things that happen). AT: "Good things come" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
These statements can be written in positive form. AT: "it is always wrong ... and it is evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: it is never good ... neither is it good

contextId.information: These phrases can be written in positive form. AT: "It is good to treat the wicked person as he deserves, and to be just to the righteous person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: It is not good to ... to the righteous person
